How do you run at root
ica n;t install driver says "run at root"
did 'sudo' now says "hange to the directory containing the downloaded file, and as the root user run the executable:

2007-11-19T08:25:00.000Z	domor		sorry didy say that
2007-11-19T08:25:00.000Z	domor		How do i run a driver when no in xserver
2007-11-19T08:26:00.000Z	domor		how can i exit xsrerv but still be in the terminal
2007-11-19T08:26:00.000Z	sethk	domor	you can change the init level
2007-11-19T08:27:00.000Z	domor	sethk	?
2007-11-19T08:28:00.000Z	sethk	domor	to run a terminal and not start the X server, you can use a lower init level, as in:   telinit 1
2007-11-19T08:28:00.000Z	domor	sethk	how do i do that
2007-11-19T08:28:00.000Z	sethk	domor	control-alt-f1 to get to a terminal, log in as root, run the command       telinit 1    (or, logged in normally,   sudo telinit 1)
2007-11-19T08:30:00.000Z	domor	sethk	is there anyway i can boot back into xserver fromcommand
2007-11-19T08:30:00.000Z	sethk	domor	yes, you can reverse the same process, and run:       telinit 3
2007-11-19T08:30:00.000Z	domor	sethk	wihtout having to resatr my whole computer
2007-11-19T08:30:00.000Z	sethk	domor	there are several ways; you rarely have to restart any *nix
